thread.title_full: WVU recognized as Most Engaged Campus for College Student Voting | Current Students | West Virginia University

title: WVU recognized as Most Engaged Campus for College Student Voting | Current Students | West Virginia University
text:
West Virginia University is one of 471 colleges and universities recognized by the [ALL IN Campus Democracy Challenge](https://allinchallenge.org/) as a 2024 ALL IN Most Engaged Campus for College Student Voting for its outstanding efforts to increase nonpartisan student voter participation in the 2024 election.
The challenge, which currently engages 10.8 million students from more than 1,075 institutions in all 50 states and Washington D.C., empowers institutions of higher education to achieve excellence in nonpartisan student democratic engagement.
Campuses that join the challenge complete a set of action items to institutionalize nonpartisan civic learning and voter participation on their campus.
“We are honored to receive this recognition and can’t wait to build upon this success to strengthen our democracy,” said [Kristi Wood Turner](https://communityengagement.wvu.edu/about/our-team/kristi-wood-turner-ed-d), director of the [Center for Community Engagement](https://communityengagement.wvu.edu/).
